content: This Italian physicist is best known for his development of the first nuclear reactor, the Chicago Pile-1.

I believe you're referring to Enrico Fermi. He was an Italian physicist who played a crucial role in the development of the first nuclear reactor, known as the Chicago Pile-1, during the Manhattan Project. Fermi was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1938 for his work on induced radioactivity. His contributions to nuclear physics and particle physics have had a lasting impact on science.
